UI_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies and reports. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution1. By 2019, this figure had increased slightly to around 1.85 million deaths3. Another source mentions that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths4. Therefore, the estimates generally range between 1 million and 2 million deaths annually due to air pollution in China.
traffic_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies and reports. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution [[1]]. By 2019, this figure had increased slightly to around 1.85 million deaths [[3]]. Another source mentions that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths [[4]]. Therefore, the estimates generally range between 1 million and 2 million deaths annually due to air pollution in China.
